item.title: More than a dozen women complain about Brisbane doctor accused of performing 'sexually motivated' checks
item.description: Dr Stan Theodoros is facing disciplinary proceedings, lodged by Queensland's health ombudsman, in the Queensland Civil and Administrative Tribunal (QCAT).

item.title: A Sydney council's $378k battle against Woolwich marina expansion
item.description: Locals have argued if the expansion in Woolwich were to go ahead it "would be like putting a bus station in the middle of a children's playground".

item.title: Council investigation finds Townsville Mayor Troy Thompson breached code of conduct
item.description: An independent council investigation found Mr Thompson breached conduct rules when circulating an email criticising another council worker's delays in responding to his request for legal funding.

item.title: Bush band tells Aboriginal people's side of the Maralinga nuclear weapon tests story
item.description: For Liam Tunkin, making music is about continuing his late father's legacy and sharing a dark part of Australia's history.

item.title: From Formula 1 to creating the 'world's best' croissant, how baking saved Lune founder Kate Reid's life
item.description: Kate Reid's Lune croissants have been called the world's best. But how did a young woman struggling with a near-fatal eating disorder end up perfecting pastry?

item.title: Donald Trump's health chief, RFK Jr, is dividing Republicans on vaccines
item.description: US Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr's anti-vaccination agenda is gaining ground, but resistance is coming from all sides.

item.title: Trump hits out at Florida's 'tough stance' on vaccines
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Hard Quiz: Think you're contestant material? Prove it
item.description: It's time to show me your exceptional trivia knowledge. Ha!

item.title: Outback nurse transforms remote diabetes care with cans, rocks and bush tucker
item.description: When Rishoniy Caine arrived in a remote NSW community with one general store and no gym, she knew fixing its diabetes problem would need a different approach to what had already failed the locals.

item.title: How to watch the 2025 Primetime Emmys in Australia
item.description: Your pocket guide to watching the Emmy awards in Australia.

item.title: Victorian farmers welcome spring forecast despite long-term climate concerns
item.description: As spring brings a flicker of hope, some farmers cautiously embrace optimism while others face mounting pressures and climate uncertainty.

item.title: Ben Hunt's Golden Point field goal sends Brisbane Broncos into NRL prelims after downing Canberra Raiders in all-time classic
item.description: Jamal Fogarty scores a try in Golden Point to send the Raiders to a preliminary final only for it to be disallowed before Ben Hunt delivers a dagger field goal.

item.title: Road repairs after flood delayed by 'excruciating' eligibility criteria
item.description: Victorian councils say they are required to provide before-and-after photos of every 100 metres of road in order to be eligible for flood recovery funding.

item.title: ANZ hit with a record $240m fine for 'unconscionable' conduct, ASX claws back early losses — as it happened
item.description: ANZ has been hit with a massive fine for unconscionable conduct impacting 65,000 customers, ranging from the federal government to dead account holders.

item.title: Specialist GPs to diagnose ADHD in WA amid calls for further easing of restrictions
item.description: As a select cohort of WA GPs begins to diagnose ADHD in people older than 10, parents of younger children and some medical professionals have expressed concerns about the scheme.

item.title: Emmys 2025 red carpet: Jenna Ortega, Lisa, Sydney Sweeney, Aimee Lou Wood, Walton Goggins, Selena Gomez and Pedro Pascal
item.description: The stars of the television industry are bringing the drama with their fashion choices.

item.title: Australia beats India in first of three ODIs before Women's Cricket World Cup
item.description: Australia's Cricket World Cup preparations are in full swing as three batters score half-centuries in a big run chase in the first of three ODIs against India.

item.title: From Tantanoola to Essendon, Angus Clarke reflects on AFL season
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Prince Harry says he has no regrets about 2023 memoir Spare
item.description: Prince Harry has defended his tell-all autobiography Spare, insisting he has no regrets about its publication.

item.title: Man sentenced over 'shocking' assault during October 2023 Malmsbury Youth Justice Centre riot
item.description: A former youth detainee is jailed over a violent assault that took place when a group of inmates stole a set of keys and sent the Malmsbury Youth Justice Centre into lockdown in October 2023.

item.title: Emmys 2025 winners: Adolescence, Severance, The Pitt and The Studio win big
item.description: The 77th Primetime Emmy Awards are honouring the best and brightest in the US television industry. Here are the shows that picked up the trophies.

item.title: Starving wallabies at The Briars spark urgent Mornington Peninsula Shire council meeting
item.description: A study prompted by the deaths of wallabies at a beloved wildlife reserve south of Melbourne finds the population has grown five times larger than what The Briars sanctuary can sustain.

item.title: Tasmania to slash 60 councillors, boost pay, under proposed council reforms
item.description: The number of councillors in Tasmania would reduce from 263 to 203, a 23 per cent decrease, under a state government proposal, while pay would increase. The government says the move will be "cost neutral".

item.title: 2025 Emmys key moments: From Hacks star Hannah Einbinder's acceptance speech to chants for Stephen Colbert
item.description: From a rallying political cry from Hacks star Hannah Einbinder to standing ovations for Stephen Colbert, here are your Emmys 2025 key moments.

item.title: Cricket Tasmania seeking ways to make proposed Macquarie Point stadium 'compatible' for matches
item.description: After initial concerns that the roof design of the proposed Hobart AFL stadium at Macquarie Point would hinder cricket matches, sporting authorities have thrown their support behind the build, saying "we will find a way".

item.title: Inmate tells inquest guards referred to Indigenous man who died in custody with derogatory slurs
item.description: An inmate, who cannot be named, provided details of an Indigenous man's treatment in custody, as an inquest into the man's death continues.

item.title: Former MMA fighter Conor McGregor drops out of Irish presidential race
item.description: Critics say the former MMA fighter's pre-emptive dropout was to save face in a likely knockout at the hands of Dublin City Council.

item.title: Fewer Aussies would need NDIS if government boosted mental health support, expert says
item.description: As the Albanese government seeks to rein in the cost of the NDIS, a former Australian of the Year says money could be saved with this one shift.

item.title: Use constitutional power to raise age of criminal responsibility nationwide, lawyers tell PM
item.description: Forty years ago, the federal government used the constitution to halt construction of the Franklin Dam. Now lawyers want the Albanese government to do the same to keep kids out of jails.

item.title: Residents encouraged to attract native bees amid varroa mite spread
item.description: A pollination ecologist says it is important people play their part in preserving native bees.

item.title: Lisa Cook and Stephen Miran set for US Federal Reserve meeting, ASX gains — as it happened
item.description: The ASX gained ground on Tuesday, while markets now have greater certainty about the make-up of the US Federal Reserve board for this week's key rates meeting. Look back on the day's events and insights on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Fears parts of Queensland will have to 'retreat' amid predicted sea level rise and increased severe weather events
item.description: The warning comes amid a national report finding up to 185,000 residential buildings in Queensland could be in "very high-risk areas" if climate change is not addressed.

item.title: Future of Bendigo Writers Festival unclear amid calls for transparent review
item.description: A councillor is demanding answers from his own executive over the botched Bendigo Writers Festival, asking colleagues whether they want to be remembered as the council that "killed" it.

item.title: Vantara wildlife facility cleared of wrongdoing by court-ordered probe in India
item.description: Conservationists had raised concerns about Vantara but investigators say the issues raised are "devoid of merit".

item.title: Lisa Reihana's exhibition, Voyager, recasts history through an Indigenous lens
item.description: The internationally renowned Maori artist's technically complex, visually mesmerising exhibition spans nearly a decade of artwork.

item.title: How to determine if your kid is well enough for child care
item.description: Work demands and a lack of village mean keeping a child at home from care every time they have a sniffle can be a dilemma for many parents. So when it it OK to send them?

item.title: Australia Diamonds announce netball squads for Test series against New Zealand, South Africa
item.description: Goal-shooter Lucy Austin is a shock selection in the Australian netball squad to face South Africa, winning a place after initially being included as an "invitee" to their training camp.

item.title: Aaron Chen talks comedy, faith, and moving to New York
item.description: How Aaron Chen went from being booted out of Sydney pubs to winning Logies and chasing global stardom.

item.title: Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, major United Nations report finds
item.description: Israel has committed and is continuing to commit genocide in Gaza, according to the "most authoritative assessment" to date.

item.title: The Federal Home Guarantee Scheme is expanding, but just how many will be able to afford to buy in?
item.description: The expansion of the scheme, which allows first home buyers to purchase a property with as little as a 5 per cent deposit, has some warning it will also inflate the market. Here's what you'll need to be earning to get a foot in the door.

item.title: Unpaid mandatory work experience a 'significant barrier' for some NSW law students
item.description: During her unpaid placement at a not-for-profit community legal centre in Sydney, Dani struggled to make ends meet. She is among some law students whose entry into the profession is fraught with financial difficulty.

item.title: SA's ongoing harmful algal bloom labelled 'cultural emergency' by First Nations groups
item.description: First Nations South Australians say the harmful algal bloom impacting the state's coastline is a cultural emergency, as it continues to devastate beaches.

item.title: Cashrewards's abrupt closure leaves shoppers many unanswered questions. Here's what we know
item.description: Two and a half million Australians have signed up for this cashback app, which leaves them wondering what's next.

item.title: Starving wallabies on the Mornington Peninsula have been spared from euthanasia after council motion
item.description: A council on Victoria's Mornington Peninsula has voted to relocate starving wallabies from The Briars wildlife sanctuary, rather than destroy them.

item.title: Macquarie Point stadium report recommends project not proceed, as Tasmanian Planning Commission flags concerns
item.description: The proposed Macquarie Point AFL stadium in Hobart should not proceed, a long-awaited assessment from the Tasmanian Planning Commission recommends.

item.title: Firefighters honoured for Black Summer efforts as CFA warns about fire season
item.description: Firefighters say they learnt a lot from the Black Summer bushfires, but fear Victorians have become complacent in preparations ahead of this fire season.

item.title: Khapra beetle, a threat to grains industry, discovered in imported nappy pants
item.description: Authorities are investigating how khapra beetle, the number-one-priority pest for the grains industry, entered Australia.

item.title: Warnings of flash flooding after torrential rain drenches Far North Queensland
item.description: Huge rainfall totals of more than 300 millimetres have taken even rain-hardened Far North Queenslanders by surprise at a typically drier time of the year.

item.title: Why 'everything feels easier' for Chloe Rykers since her breast reduction
item.description: Chloe Rykers says her "big boobs" had, in various ways, made her career harder and left her feeling uncomfortable and in pain.

item.title: Major reforms for NSW planning system aim to curb 'maze' of current process
item.description: The proposed centrepiece is a "single front door" authority to provide advice on development applications on behalf of all government agencies.

item.title: Jimmy Barnes, Dave Faulkner among music industry voices in open letter urging ANU to keep School of Music
item.description: Jimmy Barnes is among more than 40 music voices supporting an open letter to the embattled Australian National University (ANU) calling for the School of Music to be saved.

item.title: UTS to axe 1,100 subjects across education and public health, cuts 134 full-time jobs
item.description: The University of Technology Sydney will close its schools of education and public health under a multi-million-dollar restructure.

item.title: In Donald Trump's America, questions not to the president's liking are met with hostility
item.description: As America enters a dark tunnel of dangerous internal divisions and an increasingly violent public discourse, Donald Trump is escalating his attacks on many of this nation's institutions.

item.title: New WA youth detention centre likely three years away, documents show
item.description: A planned youth prison in Perth for high-risk offenders to replace the notorious Unit 18 could still be three years away and cost at least $50 million more than the initial estimate, previously unseen documents reveal.

item.title: Perth council City of Bayswater loses legal bid to stop pet cats roaming
item.description: The WA parliament has intervened to stop a Perth council from bringing in fines for people who allow their cats to leave their properties.

item.title: Hasan Piker opens up on Charlie Kirk's death, Donald Trump and Elon Musk's campaign against him
item.description: Prominent left-wing commentator Hasan Piker opens up to 7.30 on Donald Trump's left-wing crackdown, the Charlie Kirk he knew and attempts to have him deplatformed.

item.title: Frank Pangallo 'should have checked his sources' for algal bloom claims, Tarzia says
item.description: Opposition Leader Vincent Tarzia says new Liberal Party recruit Frank Pangallo "should have checked his sources" before supplying a parliamentary committee with inaccurate research citations to back up the latter's claims that desalination plants can contribute to algal blooms.

item.title: Coal miner Anglo American confirms job cuts in Brisbane, Bowen Basin
item.description: Mining giant Anglo American confirms job cuts in Brisbane and the Bowen Basin in the wake of BHP Mitsubishi Alliance axing 750 workers.

item.title: Man claims council bid to remove 'therapy' roosters is contrary to human rights conventions
item.description: A South Australian council has taken a disability pensioner to court to remove his allegedly noisy roosters, but he has argued the council's application should not proceed because it is discriminatory and the birds are his "therapeutic" animals.

item.title: Tom Atkins says players are just 'cogs in the machine' for Geelong ahead of AFL finals clash with Hawthorn
item.description: Tom Atkins hasn't missed a final since being dropped in the 2020 season, and the midfielder says one mindset helped him accept the heartache of that season.

item.title: ASX slips amid Santos sell-off, weak jobs data and 2035 emissions target — as it happened
item.description: Australia's unemployment rate remains steady at 4.2 per cent in August with a decline in full-time employment that drove the overall drop in employment numbers, according to ABS.

item.title: How youth orchestras foster lifelong friendships and open career pathways for musicians
item.description: With youth orchestras set to busk on the streets of Sydney and Melbourne this weekend, Australian musicians share how those orchestras helped shape their careers.

item.title: Patient 'devastated' as Sydney's dedicated long COVID clinic to close
item.description: A patient of NSW's first dedicated long COVID clinic in Sydney says she is "devastated" and "bewildered" that it will close at the end of the month.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel Live pulled from air by US broadcaster ABC over 'insensitive' Charlie Kirk comments
item.description: The late-night talk show's host suggested during a monologue earlier this week that Charlie Kirk's alleged killer may have been a pro-Trump Republican.

item.title: Gardeners share the joys of turning dust to daisies in the Australian outback
item.description: Flower farmer Suzanne Stanton says generations of outback women have taken comfort in their gardens, proof that life can survive in the harshest of climates.

item.title: Palliative Care Australia art prize inspires conversations about death and grieving
item.description: In its fifth year, Palliative Care Australia's Live Well, Die Well national art prize continues to spark important conversations about dying.

item.title: Sam Butler reflects on his horrific broken leg as Hawthorn prepares for Geelong in the AFL preliminary final
item.description: As he prepares to take on Geelong at the MCG for a place in the AFL grand final, Sam Butler reflects on his incredible journey back from a horrific leg break.

item.title: Suspended Townsville Mayor Troy Thompson to be hit with show-cause notice after CCC briefing
item.description: Queensland's local government minister tells state parliament that Troy Thompson may need to be sacked based on Crime and Corruption Commission allegations. Mr Thompson will have 14 days to respond to a show-cause notice.

item.title: Magpies overlook Bobby Hill for AFL preliminary final against Lions
item.description: Coach Craig McRae reveals he has spoken with Bobby Hill about his chances of playing in the AFL finals, as the Magpies ramp up preparations for Saturday's preliminary final against Lions.

item.title: Australia's 2035 climate targets on path to net zero judged by the experts
item.description: After much anticipation, Australia has its new climate targets. Now that the dice have fallen, we consult experts on their assessment of how these targets stack up with what’s at stake.

item.title: Authorities urge parents to check Little Ones Nappy Pants for khapra beetle larvae
item.description: Hundreds of cartons of nappy pants remain unaccounted for after one of the biggest threats to Australia's grain industry, khapra beetle larvae, was found in the imported products.

item.title: Domestic violence comments on fishing show breached classification rules: ACMA
item.description: An exchange about domestic violence between 'Bush Cook Ranger Nick' and the host of Step Outside with Paul Burt, broadcast on 7mate, was in breach of classification rules, the watchdog has found.

item.title: Henley residents advised to keep windows, doors closed amid algal bloom crisis
item.description: Authorities have told a group of residents living near a metropolitan Adelaide beach to close their doors and windows to prevent symptoms related to South Australia's ongoing algal bloom.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel is the latest to be put on pause. How Trump is influencing the world of late-night TV
item.description: Emmys watchers could assume there's never been a better time in Hollywood to hold its most powerful to account, but Jimmy Kimmel's axing proves otherwise.

item.title: Roosters hand Victor Radley 10-match ban for bringing NRL club into disrepute
item.description: The Sydney Roosters suspend Victor Radley for 10 matches without pay following media revelations he allegedly requested an illegal substance from former teammate Brandon Smith.

item.title: Police officer found not guilty of assault during shopping centre scuffle at Batemans Bay
item.description: A New South Wales police officer is found not guilty of using unreasonable force while removing three girls and a woman from a scuffle at a shopping centre.

item.title: Independent advice spells out mammoth task ahead for government to reach 2035 target
item.description: Getting to even the bottom end of the government's 62 to 70 per cent emissions reduction target by 2035 will require drastic increases to solar and wind power capacity, electric vehicle take-up and an extension of the safeguard mechanism, according to the Climate Change Authority.

item.title: Home owners warned to consider 'liveability' of properties amid climate change impact warning
item.description: Property experts say a "dizzying" report forecasting the impacts of worsening climate conditions on Australian properties has sounded a clear warning for the sector.

item.title: Carnival of Flowers visitors brace for wet weather while smelling the roses
item.description: Visitors flocking to Queensland's Darling Downs for the annual Carnival of Flowers in Toowoomba are advised to take an umbrella, with thunderstorms forecast for the region.

item.title: Mount Isa waits for '11th-hour' decision on financial support for copper smelter
item.description: Copper production is on the chopping block in outback Queensland, with mining giant Glencore about to decide on its future. What is the cost of losing a legacy industry?

item.title: Kitchen floor at Palmerston Regional Hospital ripped up, replaced following food safety failure
item.description: Large sections of flooring at the Northern Territory's newest, multi-million-dollar hospital are having to be ripped up and replaced after the facility failed food safety checks.

item.title: Miranda Tapsell and Gwilym Lee show it 'takes a village' to raise a child in Top End Bub
item.description: Miranda Tapsell and Gwilym Lee return to their characters from the hit movie, Top End Wedding, to take on parenthood in the TV series, Top End Bub.

item.title: Young members bring new life to the Rural Fire Service
item.description: Nearly a quarter of all western NSW Rural Fire Service volunteers are older than 70, but some younger recruits are urging others to follow in their footsteps.

item.title: No live export ships coming for WA sheep amid high prices, looming ban
item.description: Market dynamics are stopping live export ships from coming to WA for the rest of the year, raising the prospect of an official end to the trade years before a legislated ban is enforced.

item.title: Queensland government commits $4.5 million for locust control as swarms intensify
item.description: As the native pest destroys crops and pasture across outback Queensland, graziers say authorities must move swiftly to tackle them.

item.title: Pensioner sells home to move in with family in cost of living crisis
item.description: Annette Bleney worked for 45 years and never expected to find herself living week to week on her pension.

item.title: Tom Koutsantonis appointed SA Treasurer after Stephen Mullighan and Susan Close step down
item.description: Mr Koutsantonis takes the role from Stephen Mullighan, who is one of two senior ministers to resign from cabinet this week. The cabinet now has more women than men for the first time in SA's history.

item.title: QCOAL's Cook Colliery coal mine in central Queensland to close half of operation
item.description: A third Queensland coal miner has confirmed job cuts as it prepares to close one of its underground mine sites, with the company also putting the blame on rising costs and state government royalties.

item.title: Rabbits cause 'devastating' damage to Junee cemetery in southern NSW
item.description: The Junee Shire Council says it is battling a rabbit problem, which forced a recent closure of the town's main cemetery for a week, including on Father's Day, for a baiting program.

item.title: Wiluna leaders hoping 'bounty' will reduce stray dog numbers in town
item.description: Wiluna, in Western Australia's far northern Goldfields, is looking to revive a cash incentive for community members to surrender domestic dogs for rehoming.

item.title: RONA. weaves together country, colonialism and club music on new EP It's All Here
item.description: This Kaytetye producer has a fresh take on the space race that draws from First Nations knowledge and culture.

item.title: Green Gravity secures old coal mine shaft to test gravitational energy storage
item.description: A disused coal mine in Wollongong will be the first test site for a renewable energy company that lowers weights down old mine shafts to spin turbines and create electricity.

item.title: Weekly news quiz: A royal visit, a glitzy award show and a new city plays host to Laneway
item.description: A lot happened this week. Have you been paying attention?

item.title: Gareth Ward's victim tells sentencing hearing of abuse trauma
item.description: One of the victims of convicted sex offender Gareth Ward has told the former NSW MP's sentencing hearing the abuse left him traumatised and suicidal.

item.title: Late-night hosts call out 'unitary intimidation' in aftermath of Jimmy Kimmel's axing
item.description: Jimmy Kimmel's fellow late-night stars accuse the Trump administration of overriding free speech with the indefinite axing of the ABC America host, as parent company, Walt Disney, faces growing protests.

item.title: Sharks vow not to taunt Raiders in sudden-death NRL semifinal as minor premiers look to bounce back
item.description: Cronulla suggests it will not niggle Canberra in Saturday night's semifinal, despite the Brisbane Broncos successfully getting under the Raiders' skin in their thrilling one-point win.

item.title: Varroa mite could still be in SA despite removal of infected hives, PIRSA says
item.description: PIRSA says there is a chance the deadly parasite remains in the state where it was detected for the first time earlier this month.

item.title: NT attorney-general accused of hiding potential conflict of interest in link to hit-and-run driver
item.description: The Northern Territory's attorney-general is facing backlash after failing to publicly declare a potential conflict of interest regarding a fatal hit-and-run driver before court.

item.title: Patrick Dangerfield stars to send Geelong into the AFL grand final as concussion rules Tom Stewart out
item.description: Geelong utility Tom Stewart will miss the AFL grand final, but coach Chris Scott feels his Cats are in a great position to win the premiership.

item.title: Potato mop-top virus impossible to eradicate, Biosecurity Tasmania says as ninth incursion detected
item.description: Potato mop-top virus is here to stay and its source is unlikely to ever be discovered, Biosecurity Tasmania has said.

item.title: Climate risks report paints grim picture, but expert on societal collapse explains giving up is not the answer
item.description: Lethal heat, mosquito-borne viruses, mass displacement and conflict — we got a glimpse into a grim climate future. Can imagining the end of the world be good for us, or is it a path to apathy?

item.title: The inside story of an ABC report that helped scuttle Australia's biggest foreign takeover
item.description: Secrecy around a major methane leak helped Santos avoid public scrutiny for years. It backfired after a prospective bidder reportedly found out via an ABC News report.

item.title: Woman's snake bite death in Katherine sparks warnings against complacency
item.description: Experts say snake bite victims may not even be aware their lives are in imminent danger after a woman was killed by a snake in Katherine earlier this month.

item.title: Federal government's agriculture emissions reductions 'ambitious' but 'achievable'
item.description: A professor of carbon farming says the agriculture industry will "naturally" contribute to a 28 per cent emissions reduction projected by 2050, but is unlikely to hit its own net-zero targets.

item.title: Pink Floyd's album and ode to Syd Barrett Wish You Were Here turns 50
item.description: Pink Floyd looked to the past to find a way forward after the massive success of Dark Side Of The Moon in 1973. The result was Wish You Were Here, released 50 years ago this week.

item.title: Labor reshuffles its furniture as the Liberals try to save what’s left
item.description: Two resigning ministers, two major broken promises and an unfolding ecological crisis confront SA Labor six months out from a state election. Yet it's the Liberal Party staring down electoral punishment.

item.title: Perth family endure cold, wet winter in bus amid worsening housing crisis
item.description: A Perth man who has been sleeping rough in a bus with his family for the past three years wonders if he would be better off with a roof over his head and regular meals in jail.

item.title: Storm damage sees shark net installation delay at Sydney's Shark Beach in Nielsen Park
item.description: Shark Beach in Sydney's east is seasonally netted with an enclosure to protect swimmers from sharks during Sydney's warmer months — but for the upcoming school holidays, it is unlikely the nets will be installed in time.

item.title: Remote NSW council holds election after 12 years in administration
item.description: The 700 voters living in the remote Central Darling Shire Council area of New South Wales will finally head to the polls to vote again.

item.title: Tasmania's tree fern trade accused of 'greenwashing' over native forest logging links, but others say it is sustainable
item.description: Thousands of native tree ferns are harvested from Tasmania's forests for export each year. Some say the trade saves ferns from destruction, while others accuse the industry of greenwashing.

item.title: One-tray honey chicken wings are an easy family dinner - ABC News
item.description: It’s easy to make these irresistibly sticky wings that will have you licking your fingers and reaching for more.

item.title: Eucalypt trail named after botanist Dean Nicolle opens in SA
item.description: A unique partnership between an artist and a botanist has resulted in an old rail corridor in South Australia becoming an eucalypt forest.

item.title: 'America is not happy': ABC under fire for pulling Jimmy Kimmel Live!
item.description: The ABC has received hundreds of complaints about US talk show Jimmy Kimmel Live! being pulled off air and threats to boycott sponsors ... but that's the problem when two broadcasters from different countries share a name!

item.title: Wide Bay affordable housing estate scrapped due to 'unfeasible' costs
item.description: A controversial housing estate that would have been built on 26 hectares of Bundaberg's green space has been scrapped.

item.title: Turtling tracking in Broome
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Meet the diehard fans powering the green machine
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Canberra Raiders receive NRL semifinal blow, losing five-eighth Ethan Strange to illness
item.description: Canberra Raiders are forced to reshuffle their team on the morning of the semifinal against Cronulla after illness struck wunderkind Ethan Strange.

item.title: Transition from sheep to cropping in WA's Avon Valley leaving limited balloon landing sites
item.description: The move out of sheep by an increasing number of WA farmers is having an unexpected impact on the state's hot air balloon pilots.

item.title: Yolŋu people celebrate 50 years of the homelands movement in East Arnhem Land
item.description: Yolŋu children from nine Laynhapuy communities are screaming the Yothu Yindi anthem, Homeland Movement, in a ceremony celebrating the Indigenous elders who claimed back life on their country 50 years ago.

item.title: Hunter Correctional Centre prisoners refurbish rescue truck for VRA
item.description: The prisoners relished the chance to give back to the community and learn skills that could help to prevent them reoffending.

item.title: Super Netball celebrates bumper year as Sunshine Coast Lightning drives registration surge
item.description: A Queensland community is reaping the rewards of establishing the first regional professional netball team in the national league.

item.title: From Jennifer Lopez to K-pop, meet the Australian backing artists helping superstars shine
item.description: Backup dancers and backing singers spend years perfecting their craft. But who are these artists and how does it feel performing in the shadows of superstars?

item.title: Kangaroos beat Blues for 18th straight AFLW win as Cats, Hawks and Dockers triumph
item.description: Reigning premiers North Melbourne thrashes Carlton by 53 points, while Port Adelaide is stunned by an umpiring decision in its narrow loss to Geelong.

item.title: Crowds flock to Toowoomba Carnival of Flowers despite wet weather
item.description: Cold and damp conditions have not been enough to keep people away from Toowoomba's annual floral extravaganza.

item.title: Brisbane defeats Collingwood by 29 points to advance to third-straight AFL grand final
item.description: A training session on Saturday morning featuring speed work adds to Lachie Neale's optimism about returning for Brisbane in the AFL grand final after the Lions beat the Magpies.

item.title: Sharks and Knights reach NRLW preliminary finals
item.description: Cronulla keeps its season alive by defeating North Queensland, as Newcastle advances to a fourth NRLW preliminary final.

item.title: Republicans seize on Charlie Kirk's death to crack down on liberal dissent that puts freedom of speech 'in peril'
item.description: The Trump administration saw an opportunity to crack down on liberal groups in the wake of the death of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. But not all conservatives are onboard.

item.title: Scrubs is getting a reboot just in time for the hospital procedural revival
item.description: In a sea of hospital-based TV, long-running sitcoms Scrubs is often highlighted as one of the most realistic options. Now the reboot has been confirmed, and off the back of The Pitt’s big Emmy wins, we look back at the beloved show.

item.title: Jacinta Allan charts her own path with China in five-day tour of networking, photo ops and pandas
item.description: Premier Jacinta Allan has completed a tour of five Chinese cities where she has attempted to set the tone for future trade, boost Chinese international student numbers and promote her Suburban Rail Loop project.

item.title: Street artist Rone's new 90-metre mural a visual love letter to Geelong
item.description: The faces of 14 people will be immortalised in an enormous mural on the side of a new building in Geelong by locally born, globally renowned artist Rone.

item.title: How skateboarding became a family affair for Townsville single dad Jay MacAskill
item.description: For almost eight years, Jay MacAskill's skateboard was collecting dust at home — until his daughter found the skate park around the corner.

item.title: Addressing Australia's housing crisis is a mammoth task. Is making housing a human right the answer?
item.description: The ACT government has passed legislation enshrining housing as a human right. What does that mean, and should other states follow?

item.title: The Adelaide Crows have been the powerhouse of the AFLW. Now they are being challenged
item.description: The AFLW's rapid evolution has been a double-edged sword for Adelaide, which is the most successful club in competition history, having won three of the eight premierships.

item.title: Inside Ninga Mia, a forgotten community in the shadow of Kalgoorlie the city of gold
item.description: There's an eerie silence in Ninga Mia, a once thriving community on the edge of Kalgoorlie. The Aboriginal reserve is a microcosm of the cycle of displacement endured by many First Nations people.

item.title: Koori Court marks 20 years in Mildura as Victoria approaches treaty
item.description: Mildura marks two decades since its Koori Court opened, as Victoria sees mixed results in the push to reduce Indigenous incarceration and offending rates.

item.title: Crocodiles on the move in northern Australia as breeding season arrives
item.description: It's crocodile breeding season and at one central Queensland farm, the drama is on par with a reality television dating show as keepers try to work out the best pairings.

item.title: Life on Aboriginal reserve remembered by Carnarvon traditional owners
item.description: In 1975, an anthropologist wrote his thesis on Carnarvon's rich Aboriginal reserve. Decades later, traditional owners revisit the work to contribute to "big truth-telling" documentary.

item.title: Australian-born singer drops out of Russian-hosted Intervision song contest after 'political pressure'
item.description: Vassy dropped out of the contest at the last minute after coming under what Russian organisers said was "unprecedented political pressure from the government of Australia".

item.title: Explaining Aussie driving culture to make roads safer for recent arrivals
item.description: Driving a car or riding a bike may be essential for temporary migrants studying or working in Australia, but hook turns, wombat crossings, and roundabouts can be unfamiliar territory. Here are some locals working to change that.

item.title: How to clean out your wardrobe as the seasons change
item.description: It's the kind of task that can seem overwhelming, but the change of season is the perfect opportunity to review what's in your wardrobe.

item.title: F1 Azerbaijan Grand Prix: Oscar Piastri crashes on lap one, Max Verstappen wins in Baku
item.description: Oscar Piastri's worst weekend of 2025 ended with a false start, then a lap one crash, but he retains a healthy championship lead after his teammate failed to capitalise.

item.title: Australia formally recognises state of Palestine as Anthony Albanese arrives in US
item.description: The historic decision foreshadowed last month has now become a reality, as Australia moves with Canada and the United Kingdom to join the growing list of countries to recognise Palestinian sovereignty.

item.title: Older Australians to pay up to $50/hour for basic care at home under aged care changes
item.description: Older Australians entering the aged care system will have to pay for "non-clinical" services such as showers and help with medication under wide-ranging changes taking effect in November.

item.title: Pensioners left 'waiting to die' in regional Victoria as specialist healthcare costs rise
item.description: Victorian pensioner Eddie Rushforth says he does not know whether his bowel cancer has returned because he cannot afford the cost of the scans.

item.title: Commuters taking converted e-bikes on NSW trains, metro to face fines
item.description: The e-bikes posing a "higher fire risk" will be banned from trains after dozens of incidents were found to be linked to the battery technology powering them.

item.title: BOM forecasts sunny skies ahead for Queensland school holidays
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says the weather will be as good as people in the Sunshine State can hope for at this time of year, with another wet summer on the horizon.

item.title: Murray River flood may not be to blame for SA algal bloom, Senate inquiry hears
item.description: Scientists have questioned the link between the 2022-23 floods and South Australia's ongoing harmful algal bloom, despite the state government listing it as one of the three primary causes.

item.title: A timelapse showing the changing property landscape in Busselton, in Western Australia's south west.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Short-term stays are swallowing up housing stock in these WA coastal havens
item.description: With one of the nation's highest proportions of Airbnbs, some of WA's most popular tourist towns face a dilemma. Tourism is their biggest breadwinner — but with a housing crisis in full swing, short-term stays are pushing more and more locals away.

item.title: RBA says economy in cyclical upturn, ASX gains after record close on Wall Street — as it happened
item.description: RBA delivers upbeat economic assessment to parliament, but warns about the risks of a Chinese slowdown.

item.title: World leaders are meeting at the UN General Assembly this week. Here are four things to watch for
item.description: World leaders are arriving in New York for the UN General Assembly — and for the first time, Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is among them.

item.title: Optus triple-0 outage investigation underway as minister warns of 'consequences'
item.description: The Australian Media and Communications Authority begins its investigation into the Optus triple-0 outage that has been linked to multiple deaths in South Australia and Western Australia.

item.title: Australians can't trust the triple-0 network after 13-hour Optus outage results in deaths
item.description: The Optus failure is shocking and no doubt a massive fine and other sanctions could be on the way, but experts say it raises further questions.

item.title: Easy and healthy dinner recipes for spring
item.description: If you're looking for light dinner ideas as the weather warms up, we have plenty of easy options. Think veggie-filled frittatas and beef taco bowls with a few healthy swaps.

item.title: NT Police complete Kumanjayi White death in custody autopsy, with brief of evidence handed to prosecutors
item.description: The autopsy into the Aboriginal man's death in custody in Alice Springs has been completed, with the police brief of evidence handed to prosecutors to determine whether any charges should be laid.

item.title: West Swan's Pow Street residents demand water pipes be replaced after 'massive' leaks
item.description: Residents of a street in the Perth's outskirts say they are desperate after six water main bursts in the past 20 years, but the Water Corp says the pipes are only 52 years old and well within their life span.

item.title: 'It is do-able': How interim vice-chancellor Rebekah Brown plans to balance ANU's expenditure and revenue
item.description: Eight days into her new role as interim vice-chancellor at the Australian National University, Rebekah Brown sat down for an exclusive ABC interview to share her plan for getting the institution back on track.

item.title: Geelong star Max Holmes admits missing 2022 grand final hurt relationship with coach Chris Scott
item.description: Geelong speedster Max Holmes is desperate to put his previous grand-final week anger and heartbreak behind him as the Cats eye AFL premiership glory.

item.title: From Donald Trump's speech to Erika Kirk's forgiveness: What you missed at the Charlie Kirk memorial
item.description: From Donald Trump's wide-ranging speech to a potential reunion between former foes, here are the main takeaways from Charlie Kirk's memorial service in Arizona.

item.title: New hospital a 'jewel in the crown' as premier acknowledges Western Sydney health failures
item.description: Premier Chris MInns vows to make Western Sydney hospitals a "hell of a lot better," saying the current offering "hasn't been good enough".

item.title: Brisbane Broncos undecided on halves combination ahead of prelim final against Penrith
item.description: Brisbane coach Michael Maguire continues to experiment with his halves combinations on Monday as Ezra Mam takes another key step towards a return from injury.

item.title: Endangered Littlejohn's tree frog finally bred in captivity amid habitat threat
item.description: Scientists have achieved a breakthrough in their work to save the Littlejohn's tree frog species which only exists in three isolated regions in New South Wales.

item.title: Matt Rowell wins 2025 Brownlow Medal as Gold Coast star beats out Nick Daicos and Bailey Smith
item.description: Matt Rowell becomes the second Gold Coast player to win the prestigious AFL award, as a questionable voting call regarding Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera leaves the room stunned.

item.title: WA Education Minister Sabine Winton rejects claims large workload behind high teacher resignations
item.description: WA’s education minister rejects claims a record number of teachers quitting their jobs is due to them being overworked.

item.title: Hong Kong prepares for 'serious threat' from Super Typhoon Ragasa
item.description: Hong Kong rushes to prepare for the arrival of Super Typhoon Ragasa with officials warning of a "serious threat" comparable to some of the most destructive storms in the city's recent history.

item.title: UN General Assembly president Annalena Baerbock concerned about future of UN and funding
item.description: UN General Assembly president Annalena Baerbock fears for the organisation's future as she seeks a resolution in Gaza and on funding.

item.title: Stephen Page - still loving the artistic creation of dance
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: How the ANU's interim leader wants to turn its reputation around
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Ley writes to Republicans vowing to revoke Palestine recognition ahead of Albanese's UN address
item.description: In an unorthodox move, Opposition Leader Sussan Ley writes to a group of Republicans reassuring the Coalition would withdraw recognition of Palestine, ahead of a major United Nations address to be delivered by the prime minister.

item.title: Top stories from ABC News
item.description: Listen to ABC News interviews and commentary and analysis from radio programs like AM, PM and The World Today.

item.title: Russia reviving Soviet-style coercive psychiatry measures to quash dissent, says UN expert
item.description: The UN's special rapporteur on rights in Russia says the Kremlin is resorting to coercive psychiatry measures to suppress anti-war dissidents.

item.title: Moldovan authorities arrest 74 people over alleged Russia-backed election plot
item.description: The widespread raids came ahead of the country's parliamentary elections on Sunday, expected to determine whether the country will pursue closer ties with the European Union.

item.title: Multiple UK charities cut ties with Duchess of York over email to Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: The decisions come after British media reported that the Duchess had described the disgraced financier as a "steadfast, generous and supreme friend" in a 2011 letter.

item.title: Russia warned airspace violations 'risk direct armed confrontation' with NATO
item.description: Allies say they will not hesitate to shoot down Russian jets which violate NATO airspace in future siutations, after two jets entered Estonia's skies last week.

item.title: The kids growing up in 'the most dangerous place in the world to be a child'
item.description: There are a million children living in Gaza through the war between Israel and Hamas. Foreign Correspondent follows one young family trying to survive.

item.title: Report reveals culture issues, adversity faced by women in residential construction sector
item.description: A new report details the adversity faced by women in the residential construction sector revealing there is a lot of work to do once women are in the job to keep them there.

item.title: Myanmar junta revoking citizenship of actors, singers and other celebrities
item.description: Myanmar's military junta is using citizenship as a weapon, targeting political opponents, activists and even celebrities who speak out against the regime.

item.title: Three Australians lay dead as investors of Optus's parent company Singtel were buying up its shares
item.description: The actions by Optus management in the hours following a series of failed attempts by its customers to call triple-0 raises questions about the telco's fitness to operate in Australia.

item.title: Federal politics live: Anthony Albanese tells UN Israel 'must accept its share of responsibility' at Palestinian statehood summit
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says Israel "must accept its share of responsibility" and the nation's actions are putting a two-state solution between Israel and Palestine beyond reach. Follow live.

item.title: Calls for long-term plan to address Tasmania's 'concerning' school attendance level
item.description: Australia's school attendance levels have dropped since the pandemic but education experts are particularly concerned about Tasmania — a state with an already notoriously low literacy rate.

item.title: The public hospital patients who ended up paying abortion clinics for miscarriage care
item.description: Brisbane women have told the ABC they paid an abortion clinic for their chosen miscarriage care rather than getting it at their large public hospital.

item.title: Sustainable Timber Tasmania mistake 'compromised' arrests of logging protesters
item.description: New documents show some of the reasons why charges against a number of forest protesters were dropped in Tasmania, with police now assisting the company to stop it from happening in future.

item.title: Staff at Flinders University increasingly concerned as department restructure looms
item.description: Six internationally recognised marine scientists who are researching South Australia's toxic algal bloom are set to lose their jobs at Flinders University, the ABC understands.

item.title: Turtle strandings and soft-shell syndrome cases fall as seagrass beds recover
item.description: Soft-shell syndrome had been devastating green sea turtle numbers since flood events began impacting their seagrass food source in 2022.

item.title: Doctors concerned easily accessible illegal cigarettes are causing smoking rates to increase
item.description: Doctors say smoking rates are at levels they haven't seen in a decade due to easy access to illegal cigarettes that are a "quarter of the price" of legal cigarettes.

item.title: Byron Bay's 60-day holiday rental cap yields mixed results in first year
item.description: A year after controversial holiday rental caps were introduced in Byron Bay to boost rental availability, the data is unclear about whether the endeavour has been a success.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel reinstated after hundreds of stars back free speech
item.description: US comedian Jimmy Kimmel's late-night show will be reinstated after being taken off air, following remarks he made referencing right-wing activist Charlie Kirk.

item.title: Man Ray and Max Dupain's photography on display together for the first time in new Heide exhibition
item.description: Surrealist photographer Man Ray revolutionised 20th-century visual culture. In Australia, a local photographer was exploring similar territory.

item.title: Dash camera mandate for WA driving instructors considered as part of regulation review
item.description: The WA government is considering mandating the use of dash cameras for driving instructors, in a bid to better protect vulnerable student drivers.

item.title: Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera being robbed overshadowed Matt Rowell's Brownlow Medal win, and could change the voting process forever
item.description: It is not often that the AFL's night of nights gets hijacked by a moment not involving the winner of the Brownlow Medal. This is exactly what took place when Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera was seemingly robbed in broad daylight.

item.title: Brisbane drivers face longer delays at level crossings as rail network expands
item.description: Level crossing boom gates are expected to be down for much longer as Queensland adds more trains to its rail network.

item.title: Experts say paracetamol safe for pregnancy, no proof for autism link made by Donald Trump
item.description: Australia's medicines regulator says paracetamol remains safe to use during pregnancy despite Donald Trump's administration linking its use to an increased risk of autism.

item.title: Business news updates: Australian share market to rise, Wall Street registers record closing highs helped by Nvida and Apple
item.description: A rally on Wall Street is likely to send Australian stocks higher, after chipmaker Nvidia says it will invest up to $152 billion in OpenAI. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

item.title: Bushfire survivors still camping years later amid construction backlog
item.description: Five years after devastating bushfires swept through Mallacoota, some survivors are still making do with tents and camp kitchens amid a backlog of construction jobs.

item.title: Zach Merrett apologises to Essendon fans and admits 'shame' over fallout from secret Hawthorn meeting
item.description: Essendon's wantaway captain speaks publicly for the first time about his secret meeting with a Hawthorn brass that has resulted in widespread backlash from inside and outside the club.

item.title: Darwin dancer with dislocated knee left waiting for ambulance for six hours
item.description: A 20-year-old dancer was left waiting for an ambulance for more than six hours after dislocating her knee during a competition in the Darwin CBD.

item.title: Paddleboarder gets too close to whales in WA
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Paddleboarder gets too close to whales to film them, gets nudged away
item.description: Drone footage shows a paddleboarder getting too close to film a southern right whale mother and calf, and nudged away, off Point Ann.

item.title: Devonport City Council approves memorial for victims of Hillcrest jumping castle tragedy
item.description: A proposed memorial at Coles Beach for the child victims of the Hillcrest jumping castle tragedy has been unanimously approved by the Devonport City Council.

item.title: 'Pretty surreal': Matt Rowell wins 2025 Brownlow Medal
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.
